Dear Ms. Waidelich:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.

ALLEGATION:
Facility failed to complete proper background checks.
INVESTIGATION:
A complaint was received on this contracted Developmentally Disabled and
Cognitively Impaired program
I received the annual central registry clearances for DART completed by DCWL and
the spreadsheet reflects the dates the clearances were completed and the results. In
review of the spreadsheet Staff 1 had been employed for the facility since March
2019. However, the facility failed to report Staff 1 as an existing employee during
the Family First Prevention Services Act clearing of all existing employees prior to
the 1/1/20 deadline.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on May 29, 2020. She
acknowledged that it was DART’s mistake that Staff 1 was not provided on the
existing employee.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671 shall not
permit a child caring institution staff member to begin working
unless all of the following has been completed using the forms,
and in the manner, prescribed by the department:
(a) A criminal record check as referenced in R 400.4113(f),
including a fingerprint-based check of national crime information
databases, unless an alternative criminal history check has
been approved by the federal government.
611 W. OTTAWA  P.O. BOX 30664  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara  517-335-1980

(b) A check of Michigan’s child abuse and neglect central
registry or Canadian provincial agency as referenced in R
400.4113(i).
(c) A check of other states’ child abuse registry where the
person has lived in within the preceding five years.
(NOTE: Communication Issuance 19-099 providing directions
on facility’s responsibility to provide required information).
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as they failed to obtain
the proper criminal history check as prescribed by the
department.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan; no changes be
made to the license of the child caring institution.
